content:
3.112. 
Liability for the obligations of one of the spouses 
1. Recovery for the obligations of one spouse arising from transactions concluded after the registration of the marriage without the consent of the other spouse may be made out of the spouse's share of the community property, if the assets which are the spouse's separate property are insufficient to satisfy the creditors' claims. 2. The costs of the proceedings shall be reimbursed out of the spouses' personal assets, provided that the proceedings did not concern the spouses' joint property or family interests.
